means: <航海>（帆船）突遇顶风而停止前进

sentence.Network_en: Rather taken aback by such forwardness, I slammed down the phone.
sentence.Network_cn: 如此无礼的言语让我火冒三丈，我砰的一下把电话挂了。

sentence.Network_en: Cross was a little taken aback by her abrupt manner.
sentence.Network_cn: 她鲁莽的态度让克罗斯感到有点吃惊。

sentence.Network_en: Roland was taken aback by our strength of feeling.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们反应如此强烈，令罗兰大吃一惊。

lj.lj_ly: he was taken aback by her directness.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  on bæc (see a- back)For long written as two words, the term came to be treated as a single word in nautical use

entry.tran: 吃惊，震惊（以至于无法立刻作出反应）
entry.def: If you are taken aback by something, you are surprised or shocked by it and you cannot respond at once.

example.ex: Roland was taken aback by our strength of feeling...
example.tran: 我们反应如此强烈，令罗兰大吃一惊。

example.ex: Derek was taken aback when a man answered the phone.
example.tran: 德里克吓了一跳，居然是一个男的接的电话。

means.word_mean: 1. having the wind against the forward side of the sails;

sentences.sentence: "the ship came up into the wind with all yards aback"

auth_sentence.content: Rather taken aback, Rousselot admitted that it was.
auth_sentence.res_content: Rather taken aback, Rousselot admitted that it was.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Rather taken aback, Rousselot admitted that it was.

auth_sentence.content: I was a little taken aback by the question.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was a little taken aback by the question.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was a little taken aback by the question.

auth_sentence.content: He stood for a moment touched and taken aback.
auth_sentence.res_content: He stood for a moment touched and taken aback.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He stood for a moment touched and taken aback.

sentences.cn: 这条消息把我搞得措手不及。

sentences.en: The reply took him so much aback that for a moment he was lost for words.
sentences.cn: 这个答复令他猝不及防,一时不知道说些什么好。

sentences.en: I was taken aback by his rudeness.
sentences.cn: 我对他的粗鲁无礼感到吃惊。

sentences.en: I was taken aback by what I saw.
sentences.cn: 我被眼前看到的吓了一跳。

sentences.en: Jenny was taken aback by some of the portraits.
sentences.cn: 其中一些肖像画使詹妮大吃一惊。

sentences.en: She was completely taken aback by his anger.
sentences.cn: 他勃然大怒把她吓了一大跳。

sentences.en: We were all taken aback by the news of the Chairman’s resignation.
sentences.cn: 主席辞职的消息使我们都感到惊异。

sentences.en: She was taken aback by her son’s strong opposition to her remarriage.
sentences.cn: 她儿子对她再婚的强烈反对让她很吃惊。

sentences.en: He was somewhat taken aback by the news that the police intended to arrest him.
sentences.cn: 得知警方要抓他,他有点吃惊。
